messages.content:
आपके प्लॉट "ठाकरीफार्म1" में फसल की स्थिति अस्वस्थ है। यहाँ कुछ संभावित समस्याएँ और उनके उपचार दिए गए हैं:

1. **पनामा रोग (Panama Disease)**:
   - **लक्षण**: पुराने पत्तों का पीला होना और मुरझाना, पत्तों का भूरे रंग में बदलना और गिरना, तने में दरारें, तने पर पीले से लाल धब्बे, आंतरिक ऊतकों का रंग बदलना।
   - **उपचार**: इस रोग का नियंत्रण फंगीसाइड्स से नहीं किया जा सकता। इसके बजाय, पौधों को विशेष फंगीसाइड्स (10 ग्राम/10 लीटर पानी) में डुबोकर, और फिर हर दूसरे महीने मिट्टी में डालने की सिफारिश की जाती है, जो पौधों के रोपण के 6 महीने बाद शुरू किया जाना चाहिए।

2. **नाइट्रोजन की कमी (Nitrogen Deficiency)**:
   - **लक्षण**: पत्तियों का रंग हल्का हरा या हल्का लाल होना, पत्तियों की वृद्धि में रुकावट, पौधों का लंबा और पतला दिखना।
   - **उपचार**: नाइट्रोजन युक्त उर्वरकों का उपयोग करें, जैसे कि यूरिया, एनपीके, या अमोनियम नाइट्रेट। फसल उत्पादन को अनुकूलित करने के लिए मिट्टी की जांच कराना भी फायदेमंद होगा।

3. **कुकंबर मोसाइक वायरस (Cucumber Mosaic Virus)**:
   - **लक्षण**: पत्तियों पर हल्के और गहरे हरे धब्बों का पैटर्न, संक्रमित फल छोटे आकार के हो सकते हैं।
   - **उपचार**: इस वायरस का सीधे उपचार संभव नहीं है, लेकिन कीटों और वैकल्पिक मेज़बानों को नियंत्रित किया जा सकता है। यदि कीटनाशकों की आवश्यकता हो, तो डेमेटोन-मेथिल, डाइमेथोएट और मालाथियॉन का उपयोग किया जा सकता है।

कृपया इन समस्याओं का ध्यान रखें और उचित उपचार करें।

messages.content:
Aapke "Watermelon Savkar" plot mein, abhi "Vegetative growth" stage chal rahi hai, jo 14 October 2024 se shuru hui thi. Is stage ke 2nd week mein, aapko fertigation ke liye ye sujhav diye gaye hain:

### Current Week Fertigation (Week 2)
1. **Fertigation Method:**
   - **Option 1:**
     - Potassium Nitrate: 5 kg/acre
     - Urea: 2 kg/acre
   - **Option 2:**
     - Urea: 3.5 kg/acre
     - Sulfate of Potash: 4.5 kg/acre

### Next Week Fertigation (Week 3)
- **Fertigation Method:**
   - **Option 1:**
     - 12-61-0: 4 kg/acre
     - Urea: 2.5 kg/acre
   - **Option 2:**
     - 24-24-0: 7 kg/acre
     - Phosphoric acid 80%: 1.5 kg/acre
   - **Option 3:**
     - Urea: 3.5 kg/acre
     - Phosphoric acid 80%: 3.5 kg/acre

**Note:** Phosphoric acid ko dusre fertilizers se 15-20 minute pehle alag se apply karna chahiye.

Aap in sujhavon ke anusar fertigation kar sakte hain.

messages.standalone_question: What fungicides should be used for velting?
messages.standalone_en: What fungicides should be used for velting?

faq:
Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

Q: which are the insecticide and fungicide to be used for seed treatment
A: Insecticide:  Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds
Fungicide: Thiram – 2 to 3 gm/kg seed

messages.content: Velting ke liye aapko fungicide ke roop mein **Thiram** ka istemal karna chahiye. Iska istemal 2 se 3 gram per kg beej ke hisaab se karna chahiye. Ye fungicide beej ko beej roti aur seedling blight se bachata hai, jo ki beej ki germination ko sudharne mein madad karta hai.

Delta T का उपयोग क्या है?
messages.standalone_question: What is the use of Delta T?
messages.standalone_en: What is the use of Delta T?

faq:
Q: What is Delta T & VPD?
A: Delta T is the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperature values. When this value is between 2-9, the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, increasing the effectiveness of foliar applications.
   VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit) represents the right time for fertigation when active absorption by a plant is highest.

messages.content_transliterated: Delta T ka upyog kya hai?

messages.content: Delta T का उपयोग पौधों की पत्तियों पर स्टोमेटल कोशिकाओं के खुलने और बंद होने की प्रक्रिया को समझने के लिए किया जाता है। जब Delta T का मान 2-9 के बीच होता है, तो यह संकेत करता है कि स्टोमेटल कोशिकाएं खुली होती हैं, जिससे फोलियर एप्लिकेशंस (जैसे कि उर्वरक का छिड़काव) की प्रभावशीलता बढ़ जाती है। यह पौधों के लिए पोषक तत्वों के अवशोषण को अधिकतम करने में मदद करता है।

If the crop stage is very early or pruing is done recently, the water takeup by plants is negligible in this period because of very less transpiration. If this is the case, ask them to wait till irrigation Kpa in the present stage.
Sometimes, the water can remain accumulated around the sensor due to local landscaping or slope in the land around sensor. In this case, please check the around the sensor. It will have to be reinstalled properly. Chatbot should ask the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

messages.content:
आपके प्लॉट "ठाकरीफार्म1" में केले की फसल की स्वास्थ्य स्थिति "अस्वस्थ" है। यहाँ कुछ संभावित समस्याएँ और उनके उपचार दिए गए हैं:

1. **पनामा रोग (Panama Disease)**:
   - **लक्षण**: पुराने पत्तों का पीला होना और मुरझाना, पत्तों का भूरे रंग में बदलना और गिरना, तने में दरारें, तने पर पीले से लाल धब्बे, आंतरिक ऊतकों का रंग बदलना।
   - **उपचार**: इस रोग का नियंत्रण फंगिसाइड्स से नहीं किया जा सकता। इसके बजाय, पौधों को विशेष फंगिसाइड्स (10 ग्राम/10 लीटर पानी) में डुबोकर, और फिर हर दूसरे महीने मिट्टी में डालने की सिफारिश की जाती है, जो पौधों के रोपण के 6 महीने बाद शुरू किया जाना चाहिए।

2. **नाइट्रोजन की कमी (Nitrogen Deficiency)**:
   - **लक्षण**: पत्तियों का रंग हल्का हरा या हल्का लाल होना, पत्तियों की वृद्धि में रुकावट, पौधे का लंबा और पतला दिखना।
   - **उपचार**: नाइट्रोजन युक्त उर्वरकों का उपयोग करें, जैसे कि यूरिया, NPK, या अमोनियम नाइट्रेट। फसल के लिए सही उत्पाद और मात्रा जानने के लिए अपने कृषि सलाहकार से परामर्श करें।

3. **ककड़ी मोज़ेक वायरस (Cucumber Mosaic Virus)**:
   - **लक्षण**: पत्तियों पर हल्के और गहरे हरे धब्बों का पैटर्न, संक्रमित फलों का आकार छोटा होना और उनमें क्लोरोटिक रेखाएँ या नेक्रोसिस दिखाई देना।
   - **उपचार**: इस वायरस का सीधे उपचार संभव नहीं है, लेकिन वैकल्पिक मेज़बानों और कीटों को नियंत्रित किया जा सकता है। यदि कीटनाशकों की आवश्यकता हो, तो डेमेटोन-मेथिल, डाइमेथोएट और मालाथियॉन जैसे उत्पादों का उपयोग किया जा सकता है।

कृपया इन समस्याओं का ध्यान रखें और उचित उपचार करें।

faq:
Q: What is Delta T & VPD?
A: Delta T is the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperature values. When this value is between 2-9, the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, increasing the effectiveness of foliar applications.
   VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit) represents the right time for fertigation when active absorption by a plant is highest.

messages.content_transliterated: Delta T ka upyog kya hai?

messages.content: Delta T का उपयोग पौधों की पत्तियों पर स्टोमेटल कोशिकाओं के खुलने और बंद होने की प्रक्रिया को समझने के लिए किया जाता है। जब Delta T का मान 2-9 के बीच होता है, तो यह संकेत करता है कि स्टोमेटल कोशिकाएं खुली होती हैं, जिससे फोलियर एप्लिकेशंस (जैसे कि उर्वरक का छिड़काव) की प्रभावशीलता बढ़ जाती है। यह पौधों के लिए पोषक तत्वों के अवशोषण को अधिकतम करने में मदद करता है।

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.

get_irrigation_installation_settings
    retrieves the irrigation installation settings in the farmer's plots, can be used to calculate the irrigation hours.
    returns root_width, root_depth, soil_retention, dripper_distance, dripper_discharge
faq:
Q: How to measure/ calculate irrigation hours /water tank of my plot in fyllo app? How do I calculate irrigation hours for my plot? How to use the irrigation hours calculator?
A: To calculate irrigation hours in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. Open the Fyllo App
2. Go to the home screen
3. Click on the soil moisture-1 sensor
4. Scroll down to find the "Irrigation hours" section
5. Fill in the required details such as:
   - Root width (inches)
   - Root depth (inches)
   - Soil retention (mm)
   - Dripper distance (feet)
   - Dripper discharge (liters)
6. Click the calculate button

Would you like me to calculate the irrigation hours for you right now? I can retrieve your plot's irrigation settings and perform the calculation if you say yes.

Tool Selection: When user says yes, I should:
1. Use get_irrigation_installation_settings tool to retrieve plot settings
2. Check if all values are present and valid
3. If values are valid, use calculate_irrigation_hours tool with these values
4. If values are missing or invalid, ask the user to provide the missing values
5. After calculating irrigation hours, display the irrigation installation settings that were used for the calculation
6. Ask the user if they want to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values, and if yes, prompt them to provide those values

Example response if values are missing:
"I checked your plot settings, but I need some additional information to calculate irrigation hours accurately. Could you please provide the [missing value(s)]? Once you provide these details, I can complete the calculation for you."

Example response after calculation:
"Based on your plot's irrigation settings, the calculated irrigation hours are [X] hours. 

I used the following settings for this calculation:
- Root width: [value] inches
- Root depth: [value] inches
- Soil retention: [value] mm
- Dripper distance: [value] feet
- Dripper discharge: [value] liters

Would you like to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values? If yes, please provide the new values you'd like to use."

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

messages.content: Delta T is used to assess the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperatures. It helps determine the moisture content in the air and the effectiveness of foliar applications. When Delta T is between 2-9, it indicates that the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, which enhances the absorption of nutrients during foliar spraying. This information is crucial for optimizing irrigation and fertigation practices, ensuring that plants receive the right amount of water and nutrients at the right time.

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

Q: How to measure/ calculate irrigation hours /water tank of my plot in fyllo app? How do I calculate irrigation hours for my plot? How to use the irrigation hours calculator?
A: To calculate irrigation hours in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. Open the Fyllo App
2. Go to the home screen
3. Click on the soil moisture-1 sensor
4. Scroll down to find the "Irrigation hours" section
5. Fill in the required details such as:
   - Root width (inches)
   - Root depth (inches)
   - Soil retention (mm)
   - Dripper distance (feet)
   - Dripper discharge (liters)
6. Click the calculate button

Would you like me to calculate the irrigation hours for you right now? I can retrieve your plot's irrigation settings and perform the calculation if you say yes.

Tool Selection: When user says yes, I should:
1. Use get_irrigation_installation_settings tool to retrieve plot settings
2. Check if all values are present and valid
3. If values are valid, use calculate_irrigation_hours tool with these values
4. If values are missing or invalid, ask the user to provide the missing values
5. After calculating irrigation hours, display the irrigation installation settings that were used for the calculation
6. Ask the user if they want to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values, and if yes, prompt them to provide those values

Example response if values are missing:
"I checked your plot settings, but I need some additional information to calculate irrigation hours accurately. Could you please provide the [missing value(s)]? Once you provide these details, I can complete the calculation for you."

Example response after calculation:
"Based on your plot's irrigation settings, the calculated irrigation hours are [X] hours. 

I used the following settings for this calculation:
- Root width: [value] inches
- Root depth: [value] inches
- Soil retention: [value] mm
- Dripper distance: [value] feet
- Dripper discharge: [value] liters

Would you like to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values? If yes, please provide the new values you'd like to use."

messages.content:
The analysis of your banana crop at **Thakrifarm1** indicates potential issues:

1. **Panama Disease** (Fungal Infection)
   - **Symptoms**: Yellowing and wilting of old leaves, brown collapsing leaves, splitting stems, yellowish to reddish streaks on stems, discoloration of internal tissues, and eventual rotting of all plant parts.
   - **Treatment**: Unfortunately, this disease cannot be controlled with fungicides. It is recommended to dip plantlets in specific fungicides (10g per 10 liters of water) and drench the soil every two months, starting six months after planting. Consider an integrated approach with preventive measures and biological treatments.

2. **Nitrogen Deficiency** (Nutrient Deficiency)
   - **Symptoms**: Pale green leaves, light red petioles and veins, stunted leaf growth, and a long, thin appearance of the plant.
   - **Treatment**: Use nitrogen-rich fertilizers such as Urea, NPK, or ammonium nitrate. It's advisable to consult with an agricultural advisor for the best product and dosage. Conduct a soil test before the cropping season to optimize production.

3. **Cucumber Mosaic Virus** (Viral Infection)
   - **Symptoms**: Light and dark green mottles and mosaics on leaves, smaller fruits with chlorotic lines or necrosis.
   - **Treatment**: Direct treatment is not possible, but controlling alternative hosts and vectors can help. If insecticides are necessary, consider using products like demeton-methyl, dimethoate, or malathion as foliar sprays. Note that these chemicals can be toxic to humans and animals.

Please take appropriate action based on these findings to improve the health of your banana crop.
What is a use of Delta t
messages.standalone_question: What is the use of Delta t?
messages.standalone_en: What is the use of Delta t?

faq:
Q: What is Delta T & VPD?
A: Delta T is the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperature values. When this value is between 2-9, the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, increasing the effectiveness of foliar applications.
   VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit) represents the right time for fertigation when active absorption by a plant is highest.

messages.content: Delta T is used to determine the optimal conditions for foliar applications in plants. When the Delta T value is between 2-9°C, it indicates that the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, which enhances the effectiveness of foliar sprays. This means that applying fertilizers or pesticides during this range can lead to better absorption and overall plant health.

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

messages.content:
The analysis of your crop image indicates that the health of your pepper plants is unhealthy. Here are some possible diagnoses:

1. **Bacterial Spot of Pepper** (Likelihood: Possible)
   - **Symptoms**: 
     - Small, yellow-green lesions on young leaves.
     - Dark, water-soaked lesions on older leaves with yellow circles.
     - Deformed and twisted leaves.
     - Water-soaked areas on fruit that become rough and brown.
   - **Treatment**: Consider using copper-containing bactericides as a protectant. Apply at the first sign of disease and then every 10 to 14 days during warm, moist conditions.

2. **Pesticide Damage** (Likelihood: Very Unlikely)
   - **Symptoms**: 
     - Leaf spots or larger patches.
     - Yellowing and wilting leaves.
     - Scorch or tip burn.
   - **Treatment**: There are no chemical control options for pesticide burn. Ensure to use pesticides according to instructions. In severe cases, you can spray urea or polyfeed diluted in water.

3. **Flea Beetles** (Likelihood: Very Unlikely)
   - **Symptoms**: 
     - Feeding damage with yellowing on leaves.
     - Small shot-like holes.
     - Small, dark, shiny or metallic beetles.
   - **Treatment**: Apply insecticides during the beetle's susceptible period. Products based on chlorpyrifos are effective.

Please monitor your plants closely and consider taking appropriate action based on these findings. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Fal ruthi mai phosphorus ki jarurat kab padati hai
messages.standalone_question: When does a plant need phosphorus?
messages.standalone_en: When does a plant need phosphorus?

messages.content:
Fal ruthi (fruit crops) mein phosphorus ki jarurat aksar unke vikas ke prarambhik charan mein hoti hai, khaas taur par:

1. **Sowing ke samay**: Jab aap beej boya rahe hote hain, tab phosphorus ka istemal beej ki jadhon ko majboot karne ke liye hota hai.
2. **Vegetative Growth Stage**: Is charan mein, phosphorus ka istemal patton aur jadhon ki vikas ko badhane ke liye hota hai.
3. **Flowering and Fruiting Stage**: Jab phool aur phal aate hain, tab bhi phosphorus ki avashyakta hoti hai, kyunki yeh phalon ki gunvatta aur utpadan ko sudharne mein madad karta hai.

Agar aapko kisi vishesh samay ya charan ke liye phosphorus ki jarurat ka pata karna hai, to aap apne plot ke crop stage aur soil health ko dhyan mein rakhkar samay nirdharit kar sakte hain.

faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.

- **October 21**: Avg Temp: 27°C, Rainfall: 1 mm
- **October 22**: Avg Temp: 27°C, Rainfall: 0 mm
- **October 23**: Avg Temp: 26°C, Rainfall: 1 mm

### Crop Stage:
Nimma crop active stage "Break Bud" (BRAKE_BUD_FRUIT_PRUNING) nalli ide, 2024-10-18 nalli prarambha aayitu.

### Analysis:
1. **Soil Moisture**: KPa values indicate wet soil, which is normal for the current crop stage.
2. **Weather Conditions**: Recent rainfall (1 mm on October 21 and 23) and moderate temperatures have contributed to the moisture levels.
3. **Crop Stage**: Since the crop is in the "Break Bud" stage, transpiration is relatively low, which can lead to slower moisture increase.

messages.content_transliterated: kaptaf 1gm+kitazin 0.70ml

messages.content:
कॅप्टाफ (Captan) आणि किटाझिन (Kitazin) यांचा वापर पिकांच्या संरक्षणासाठी केला जातो. कॅप्टाफ 1 ग्रॅम आणि किटाझिन 0.70 मिली यांचे मिश्रण पिकांच्या रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी उपयुक्त आहे. 

कृपया याचा वापर करताना योग्य प्रमाण आणि पद्धतींचा विचार करा, तसेच स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घ्या.
Captan and kitazin प्रमाण किती
messages.standalone_question: What is the recommended dosage of Captan and Kitazin?
messages.standalone_en: What is the recommended dosage of Captan and Kitazin?

messages.content:
कॅप्टाफ (Captan) आणि किटाझिन (Kitazin) यांचे प्रमाण सामान्यतः खालीलप्रमाणे असते:

- **कॅप्टाफ**: 1 ग्रॅम प्रति लिटर पाण्यात.
- **किटाझिन**: 0.70 मिली प्रति लिटर पाण्यात.

हे प्रमाण पिकांच्या संरक्षणासाठी वापरले जाते. कृपया याचा वापर करताना स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घ्या आणि योग्य पद्धतींचा विचार करा.
Pspa and z78 प्रमाण किती
messages.standalone_question: What is the recommended dosage of Pspa and Z78?
messages.standalone_en: What is the recommended dosage of Pspa and Z78?

messages.content:
PSPA (Pseudomonas syringae) आणि Z78 (Zinc 78) यांचे प्रमाण सामान्यतः खालीलप्रमाणे असते:

- **PSPA**: 1-2 मिली प्रति लिटर पाण्यात.
- **Z78**: 0.5-1 मिली प्रति लिटर पाण्यात.

हे प्रमाण पिकांच्या संरक्षणासाठी वापरले जाते. कृपया याचा वापर करताना स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घ्या आणि योग्य पद्धतींचा विचार करा.
